info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 9 at 7:48AM AKST until November 9 at 7:45PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Ward Lake near areas near the Ward Lake recreational area.
* WHEN...Until 745 PM AKST Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 746 AM AKST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near Ward Lake. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are possible through Sunday afternoon.
- For Lake Connell Dam: At 7:30am the stage was 252.8 feet. Flood Stage is 252.0 feet.
Impacts: At 252.0 feet: 2 feet of water will be going over the emergency spillway which will produce minor flooding of areas around the Ward Lake recreation area with trails and Last Chance campground being inundated.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM AKST THIS EVENING
